kenticocommunity.qandaanswerdata.QAndAAnswerDataContent:
@refinedElement
Thanks for trying out the Community Portal project!
Did you [start up Azurite](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v28.4.2.1/docs/Development.md#start-azurite) before starting your ASP.NET Core application?
If you are using VS Code, there's an extension to make it really easy to turn on/off. If you are using VS or Rider, you'll need to run Azurite from the command line.
As a side note, I've thought about using [.NET Aspire](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/aspire/get-started/aspire-overview) to improve the local dev experience now that there are more external dependencies. I'll need to find out how well Xperience works with Aspire.
---
I think I'll update the way [the background service initializes](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v28.4.2.1/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Web/Features/Support/SupportMessageProcessorHostedService.cs#L41) to skip creating the queue/storage clients if [support request processing is disabled](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v28.4.2.1/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Web/App_Data/CIRepository/%40global/kenticocommunity.supportrequestconfiguration/b7b65898-a05d-42b2-a14b-0feee51a712b.xml#L7)
